overview_summary: All five neighbors have no recorded stance on the proposed development, with **0 supporting**, **0 opposing**, and **5 unknown**. None hold formal public roles; two (Howard and Reaser households) have moderate influence as longstanding landowners, while the rest are **low-influence** private residents.

neighbors.name: Bron & Shellie Howard
neighbors.claims: The Howard family is known for farming wheat, hay and cattle near Headrick for six generations ([www.okfarmbureau.org](https://www.okfarmbureau.org/district-2-the-howard-family/#:~:text=Renee%20was%20still%20not%20sure,alongside%20Bob%20and%20his%20family)). No evidence was found of Bron or Shellie Howard participating in local energy or development debates as of 2025 (no news or meeting records reference them).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via local ag community networks (e.g., farm bureau), emphasizing respect for their family’s farming legacy and assuring farmland preservation.

neighbors.name: Shane Reaser & Lori Willis
neighbors.claims: Shane Reaser and Lori Willis jointly own multiple agricultural parcels in Jackson County (nine parcels near Headrick) ([southkcnews.com](https://southkcnews.com/stories/655139236-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-jackson-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Subsidies%20Received%20by%20Jackson%20County,Code%20Farmers%20in%202021)). They have no public profile of commenting on development or clean energy projects (no references to them appear in local news archives).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through peer farmers they trust, addressing how the project can protect long-term land value and farming operations.

neighbors.name: Troy D. Metheny III
neighbors.claims: Troy D. Metheny III resides in Jackson County as the third-generation namesake of his family (suffix “III” indicating multi-generational presence). He has shown personal interest in family heritage, once posting about Metheny ancestors dating back to the 1700s ([www.genealogyworld.com](https://www.genealogyworld.com/mgc/geobook.html#:~:text=,Comments%3A%20I)). There are no public statements or records of him taking a position on local development proposals.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one highlighting respect for his family’s long history in the area, and discuss how the project honors local heritage.

neighbors.name: Stuart & Karen Ferguson
neighbors.claims: Stuart Ferguson is a retired Altus Air Force Base veteran who settled with his wife Karen in Headrick after 1990 ([www.harmoncountyfuneral.com](https://www.harmoncountyfuneral.com/obituaries/Karen-Ferguson?obId=19264077#:~:text=before%20returning%20to%20Oklahoma,spent%20their%20remaining%20years%20together)). Karen Ferguson (born 1947) was active in church and community, volunteering in local polling and prayer ministry until her passing in 2020 ([www.harmoncountyfuneral.com](https://www.harmoncountyfuneral.com/obituaries/Karen-Ferguson?obId=19264077#:~:text=and%20homemaker%2C%20Housemother%20for%20Oklahoma,and%20taking%20care%20of%20her)) ([www.harmoncountyfuneral.com](https://www.harmoncountyfuneral.com/obituaries/Karen-Ferguson?obId=19264077#:~:text=Baptist%20Church%20in%20Madill%2C%20Oklahoma,bible%20study%2C%20traveling%20the%20United)). Neither has any record of speaking publicly on development issues in Jackson County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community member from their church or veteran circle reach out, keeping the conversation personal and low-key out of respect for their quiet retirement.

neighbors.name: Michael & Linda Dishman
neighbors.claims: Michael and Linda Dishman have lived in the Headrick area for decades; their son Derick G. Dishman, 41, is listed as residing in Headrick ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/derrick-dishman#:~:text=Derick%20G%20Dishman%20Age%3A%2041,In%20Headrick%2C%20Ok)). They maintain a low public profile with no known involvement in local civic boards or public commentary on development. No media or official records link the Dishmans to any stance on energy projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly manner through a familiar community acquaintance, reassuring them that their peace and privacy will be respected.
